page.title: 02Farming in Rutland
page.content:
Three wide, gently-sloping ridges run west to east towards the flood plain of the River Welland, separated by shallow valleys. The soils are mostly clay, artificially drained in the fields, and thin on the hilltops to expose the ironstone rock.
{Arable Farming} Many farms are large - over 250 acres, with fields of 80 acres or more. Most of the farms are owner-occupied. In recent years hedges have been removed to allow for greater use of machinery. Wheat, barley, potatoes and oil-seed rape are grown, with some peas, beans and oats.
{Pastoral Farming Fresian cattle give milk and beef, sheep for meat and some wool, while horses are grazed in local paddocks.
